events.name: BIOZINFORMATICA
events.description: An inter-college bio quiz event covering everything from basic biology to biotechnology and bioinformatics.

event_rounds.description: Written MCQ-based test covering biology from standard 9 to 12 and basic knowledge.
Advanced quiz round for qualifying teams/individuals.

events.name: BIOTEXPRESSION
events.description: A dynamic event for showcasing models, posters, and presentations on various aspects of biotechnology.

rules.equipment_provided: Only poster boards; participants must bring their own laptops and other equipment.

events.name: HEALTHY BITES
events.description: A cooking competition where participants create a nutritious snack, beverage, and dessert.

hygiene_requirements: Gloves and masks must be worn

events.name: CLUEX
events.description: The interschool quiz competition of URECKON’25, testing general knowledge and quick thinking.

rules.team_size: 2 members per team, no limit on teams per school
rules.eligibility: School students (Class 8 to 12) with valid school ID
rules.electronics_usage: Not allowed (Mobile Phones, Tablets, Calculators, Smart Watches)

events.name: STAR SPRINT
events.description: An astronomical quiz competition to test knowledge of universal mysteries.

rules.team_size: Maximum 2 members per team, solo participation allowed
rules.response_format: Verbal, responses must be clear and concise

events.name: APPTIFY
events.description: A competition to test app development skills with innovative solutions.

rules.prelims: Google Form Quiz (30 mins, 35 questions, Top 15 qualify)
rules.finals: 4-hour challenge to build an app UI with a given problem statement
rules.evaluation_criteria: UI, Features, Response Time, Completeness (Total: 100 points)
rules.code_submission: Git repository with updated code & APK/video

events.name: ThinkTech
events.description: A quiz blending business and technology knowledge.

rules.team_size: 2 members per team, solo participation allowed
rules.eligibility: Participants must be under 25 years old with valid ID

events.name: SPYDER
events.description: A challenge to showcase web design and development skills.

rules.rounds: 2 rounds: Prelims (Mockup design) and Finals (Full platform development)
rules.evaluation_criteria: Design accuracy, code quality, responsiveness, completeness, bug-free implementation, innovation
rules.prohibited: AI website builders (WordPress, Wix, etc.) in prelims

events.name: ARE-U-HOLMES
events.description: A platform where students will showcase their intelligence by solving puzzles and decoding riddles to progress through levels and find a hidden treasure.

rules.eligibility: Open to students from any institution and any educational stream

event_rounds.description: Teams solve riddles to find coins placed at different locations. The top 5 teams with the highest number of coins qualify for the final round.
Finalists solve riddles to reach a hidden treasure, passing through various challenges, including charades. Winners are awarded gold, silver, and bronze balls.

events.name: SELLINGOPEDIA
events.description: A platform for students to showcase their entrepreneurship skills, including marketing, consumer interaction, and sales strategies.

rules.eligibility: Open to students from any institution and any educational stream

event_rounds.description: A business quiz with 20 open-ended questions. Top 6 teams qualify for the final round.
Participants pick 2 products and sell them to judges within a limited time frame.

events.name: MANDI
events.description: A business event testing participants' estimation skills, market awareness, and decision-making abilities.

rules.eligibility: Open to students from any institution and any educational stream, including alumni from UEMK and IEM

event_rounds.description: Teams estimate the price of a set of items. The 5 closest estimates qualify for the final round.
Qualified teams estimate the weight of displayed items without measuring tools. Closest estimates determine the winner.
